Functionalized lipid probes are at the intersection of several niche biotechnologies. This overview will serve as a brief summary of the capabilities, nuances, and caveats of their utility. Additional resources and published review articles will be linked below for greater detail.

## Functional moieties

:::{.border}

```{r setup, echo=FALSE, include=FALSE}
library(plotly)

library(plotly)

# Load your image
image_url <- "LipidProbe/Structures/SphingosineStructure.png"

# Define hover regions (as rectangles)
shapes <- list(
  list(type = "rect", x0 = 0, x1 = 32, y0 = 50, y1 = 85,
       line = list(color = "red", width = 2),
       fillcolor = "rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.1)",  # Transparent fill
       name = "Region 1", hoverinfo = "none"),
  list(type = "rect", x0 = 50, x1 = 70, y0 = 40, y1 = 60,
       line = list(color = "blue", width = 2),
       fillcolor = "rgba(0, 0, 255, 0.1)",  # Transparent fill
       name = "Region 2", hoverinfo = "none")
)

# Define hover annotations
hover_annotations <- data.frame(
  x = c(20, 60),  # Midpoints of rectangles
  y = c(80, 50),
  text = c("Region 1 Info", "Region 2 Info")
)

# Create the plot
plot <- plot_ly() %>%
  add_trace(
    data = hover_annotations,
    x = ~x, y = ~y, text = ~text,
    mode = "markers",
    marker = list(opacity = 0),  # Invisible markers
    hoverinfo = "text"  # Show hover text
  ) %>%
  layout(
    shapes = shapes,
    images = list(
      list(
        source = image_url,
        xref = "x",
        yref = "y",
        x = 0,
        y = 100,
        sizex = 100,
        sizey = 100,
        xanchor = "left",
        yanchor = "top",
        layer = "below"
      )
    ),
    xaxis = list(visible = FALSE, range = c(0, 100)),
    yaxis = list(visible = FALSE, range = c(0, 100))
  )
```

```{r, echo=FALSE, warnings=FALSE}
# Render the plot
plot
```
